page.title: 07HOLY TRINITY CHURCH PRIVETT
page.content: This Church was built in 1876 on the site of a Church dated, it is believed,1391. The 160 ft spire is a landmark for miles around. The main fabric is of flint, brick and stone and its lofty roof supported by moulded pine beams reaches 52 ft from floor to ridge. Inside are fine columns of marble and stone, a magnificent carved stone reredos and pulpit and the altar with its ornate mosaic floor is approached by seven steps of black Belgian marble. Built by the principal landowner,this Church was intended to serve the family and retainers of the estate.When the family moved away the 150 parishioners were left with the task of maintaining it.Heating costs alone were exorbitant and in the 1960's when extensive repairs to the roof became urgent the parish approached the Diocese.
